description.short_desc: Actions for REST request such as GET, PUT, POST, DELETE etc.

detailed_desc.p: This keyword library provides REST Actions that can be used by all three DDE Drivers--CycleDriver, SuiteDriver, and StepDriver. That means they can be used in any keyword driven test tables regardless of the test tables level--Cycle, Suite, or Step.
Each different action has different parameters as described in its documentation. For reference, the first fields of ALL REST Action test records are defined below:

dl.dd: The "T" = Component Action record type specifier.

detailed_desc.code: T, SAFSREST, RestGet, sessionID, relativeURI, body, ContentType, responseIDVar
detailed_desc.p: REST Action parameters must be placed in the test record in the field position specified in the documentation. Some parameters are optional. However, the field associated with that parameter must be honored. If you wish to skip an optional parameter you must still provide an empty field for that parameter.
detailed_desc.code: T, SAFSREST, RestGet, sessionID, relativeURI, , , responseIDVar
detailed_desc.p: The above example shows two optional fields after relativeURI which are given no value(skipped).

description.short_desc: Perform the "GET" method on a REST service within a session.
description.detailed_desc: Perform the "GET" method on a REST service within a session. The requested content type could be "BINARY", "JSON", "TEXT", "XML", "HTML", "IMAGE", "CSS" and "SCRIPT" etc. The keyword RestStartServiceSession MUST be executed before executing this keyword.

description.short_desc: The ID used to identify a session.
description.detailed_desc:
There is a base URL stored for the session, and it will be prepended to a relative URI to form a REST service URL.
If the ID is not provided or invalid, then this keyword will be handled as "no session" scenario; the following parameter 'relativeURI' should be provided with a full-path URL; user might need to provide some extra information such as authentication etc.

description.short_desc: The relative URI combined with a base-URL (stored in a session) to form a REST service URL.
The body to send with this REST request.
The content type of the body included in this REST request. It is ONLY useful when the parameter body is specified; otherwise it will be ignored.
description.detailed_desc:
The content type can be one of following options:
BINARY
JSON
TEXT
XML
HTML
IMAGE
CSS
SCRIPT

description.short_desc: The name of the variable holding the ID (generated internally), which is used to get the Response Object from the internal Map.
The headers to be included in this REST GET request. Such as "If-Modified-Since: Sat, 29 OCT 1994 19:43:31 GMT".
The authentication information to guarantee this one-shot connection successful.

short_desc.p: Execute a GET method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/CUSTOMER/"

detailed_desc.p: Execute a GET method on REST service URL formed by prepending the base-URL to the relative-URI "sqlrest/CUSTOMER/"

The base-URL is gotten according to sessionID "BayerCustomerService" (assigned when executing keyword RestStartServiceSession). If it is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/", then the full REST Service URL is "http://www.thomas-bayer.com/sqlrest/CUSTOMER/". The Response Object will be stored in an internal Map with a generated ID, which will be saved to a variable BayerCustomerGetResponseIDVariable.
